datasets.name: bb7e5c78
datasets.query:
with jobs_usage_with_list_cost as (
  SELECT
    t1.*,
    t1.usage_quantity * list_prices.pricing.default as list_cost
  FROM
    system.billing.usage t1
    INNER JOIN system.billing.list_prices list_prices on t1.cloud = list_prices.cloud
    and t1.sku_name = list_prices.sku_name
    and t1.usage_start_time >= list_prices.price_start_time
    and (
      t1.usage_end_time <= list_prices.price_end_time
      or list_prices.price_end_time is null
    )
  WHERE
    t1.billing_origin_product = 'JOBS'
),
weekly_jobs_list_cost as (
  select
    date_sub(
      to_date(usage_start_time),
      dayofweek(to_date(usage_start_time))
    ) as week_start,
    SUM(list_cost) as list_cost,
    COUNT(distinct to_date(usage_start_time)) as days
  from
    jobs_usage_with_list_cost t1
  group by
    all
  having
    days = 7
  order by
    1 asc,
    2 asc
),
list_cost_growth as (
  select
    week_start,
    list_cost,
    100 * (
      list_cost - lag(list_cost, 1) over (
        order by
          week_start
      )
    ) / lag(list_cost, 1) over (
      order by
        week_start
    ) as weekly_growth
  from
    weekly_jobs_list_cost
  order by
    week_start asc
)
select
  week_start,
  weekly_growth,
  avg(weekly_growth) over (
    order by
      week_start ROWS BETWEEN 12 preceding
      AND CURRENT ROW
  ) as 3_months_growth_moving_avg,
  list_cost
from
  list_cost_growth;

with most_recent_jobs as (
  SELECT
    *,
    ROW_NUMBER() OVER(
      PARTITION BY workspace_id,
      job_id
      ORDER BY
        change_time DESC
    ) as rn
  FROM
    system.lakeflow.jobs QUALIFY rn = 1
),
billing_w_org_team as (
  SELECT
    t1.*,
    {catalog}.{schema}.team_name_from_tags(t1.custom_tags, t2.tags) as team_name
  FROM
    system.billing.usage t1
    LEFT JOIN most_recent_jobs t2 ON t1.workspace_id = t2.workspace_id
    AND t1.usage_metadata.job_id = t2.job_id
)
SELECT
  t1.*
except(team_name),
  t2.workspace_name,
  t1.usage_metadata.job_id as job_id,
  coalesce(t3.name, t1.usage_metadata.job_id) as job_name,
  ifnull(
    {catalog}.{schema}.job_type_from_sku(t1.sku_name),
    'UNKNOWN'
  ) as job_type_from_sku,
  ifnull(t1.team_name, 'unknown') as team_name,
  t1.usage_metadata.job_run_id as run_id,
  t1.identity_metadata.run_as as run_as,
  t1.usage_quantity * list_prices.pricing.default AS list_cost
FROM
  billing_w_org_team t1
  INNER JOIN system.billing.list_prices list_prices ON t1.cloud = list_prices.cloud
  AND t1.sku_name = list_prices.sku_name
  AND t1.usage_start_time >= list_prices.price_start_time
  AND (
    t1.usage_end_time <= list_prices.price_end_time
    or list_prices.price_end_time is NULL
  )
  INNER JOIN {catalog}.{schema}.workspace_reference t2 USING (workspace_id)
  LEFT JOIN most_recent_jobs t3 ON t1.workspace_id = t3.workspace_id
  AND t1.usage_metadata.job_id = t3.job_id
WHERE
  t1.billing_origin_product = 'JOBS'
  AND t1.usage_metadata.job_id IS NOT NULL
  AND t1.usage_metadata.job_run_id IS NOT NULL;

datasets.name: 0655a5b3
datasets.query:
with most_recent_jobs as (
  SELECT
    *,
    ROW_NUMBER() OVER(
      PARTITION BY workspace_id,
      job_id
      ORDER BY
        change_time DESC
    ) as rn
  FROM
    system.lakeflow.jobs QUALIFY rn = 1
),
billing_w_org_team as (
  SELECT
    t1.*,
    t1.usage_metadata.job_id as job_id,
    {catalog}.{schema}.team_name_from_tags(t1.custom_tags, t2.tags) as team_name
  FROM
    system.billing.usage t1
    LEFT JOIN most_recent_jobs t2 ON t1.workspace_id = t2.workspace_id
    AND t1.usage_metadata.job_id = t2.job_id
),
jobs_usage_with_list_cost as (
  SELECT
    t1.*,
    t1.usage_quantity * list_prices.pricing.default as list_cost
  FROM
    billing_w_org_team t1
    INNER JOIN system.billing.list_prices list_prices on t1.cloud = list_prices.cloud
    and t1.sku_name = list_prices.sku_name
    and t1.usage_start_time >= list_prices.price_start_time
    and (
      t1.usage_end_time <= list_prices.price_end_time
      or list_prices.price_end_time is null
    )
  WHERE
    t1.billing_origin_product = 'JOBS'
)
SELECT
  t1.*,
  t3.workspace_name,
  coalesce(t4.name, t1.job_id) as job_name,
  try_divide(
    (last30DaySpend - last30to60DaySpend),
    last30to60DaySpend
  ) * 100 AS Last30DayGrowth
FROM
  (
    SELECT
      SUM(list_cost) AS spend,
      workspace_id,
      job_id,
      sku_name,
      ifnull(
        {catalog}.{schema}.job_type_from_sku(sku_name),
        'UNKNOWN'
      ) as job_type_from_sku,
      ifnull(team_name, 'unknown') as team_name,
      SUM(
        CASE
          WHEN usage_end_time BETWEEN date_add(current_date(), -30)
          AND (current_date() - 1) THEN list_cost
          ELSE 0
        END
      ) AS Last30DaySpend,
      SUM(
        CASE
          WHEN usage_end_time BETWEEN date_add(current_date(), -60)
          AND date_add(current_date(), -31) THEN list_cost
          ELSE 0
        END
      ) AS Last30to60DaySpend
    FROM
      jobs_usage_with_list_cost
    GROUP BY
      ALL
  ) t1
  INNER JOIN {catalog}.{schema}.workspace_reference t3 USING (workspace_id)
  LEFT JOIN most_recent_jobs t4 USING (workspace_id, job_id);

tagraw as (

      {catalog}.{schema}.job_type_from_sku(t1.sku_name),
      'UNKNOWN'
    ) as job_type_from_sku,

  from

    INNER JOIN system.billing.list_prices list_prices on t1.cloud = list_prices.cloud
    and t1.sku_name = list_prices.sku_name
    and t1.usage_start_time >= list_prices.price_start_time
    and (
      t1.usage_end_time <= list_prices.price_end_time
      or list_prices.price_end_time is null
    )
  WHERE
    t1.billing_origin_product = 'JOBS'
    and t1.usage_metadata.job_id IS NOT NULL
    AND t1.usage_date >= CURRENT_DATE() - INTERVAL 30 DAY
),
tagspend as (
  select
    workspace_id,
    job_id,
    job_type_from_sku,
    team_name as tagbucket,
    sum(list_cost) as list_cost
  from
    tagraw
  group by
    ALL
)
select
  t1.*,
  t3.workspace_name,
  coalesce(t4.name, t1.job_id) as job_name
from
  tagspend t1
  INNER JOIN {catalog}.{schema}.workspace_reference t3 USING (workspace_id)

datasets.name: 12c6b9d3
datasets.query:
with most_recent_jobs as (
  SELECT
    *,
    ROW_NUMBER() OVER(
      PARTITION BY workspace_id,
      job_id
      ORDER BY
        change_time DESC
    ) as rn
  FROM
    system.lakeflow.jobs QUALIFY rn = 1
),
billing_jobs_w_org_team as (
  SELECT
    workspace_id,
    job_id,
    ifnull(max(team_name), 'unknown') as team_name
  FROM
    (
      SELECT
        coalesce(t1.workspace_id, t2.workspace_id) as workspace_id,
        coalesce(t1.usage_metadata.job_id, t2.job_id) as job_id,
        {catalog}.{schema}.team_name_from_tags(t1.custom_tags, t2.tags) as team_name
      FROM
        system.billing.usage t1 FULL
        OUTER JOIN most_recent_jobs t2 ON t1.workspace_id = t2.workspace_id
        AND t1.usage_metadata.job_id = t2.job_id
    )
  group by
    all
),
job_run_timeline_with_cost as (
  SELECT
    t1.*,
    t1.usage_metadata.job_id as job_id,
    t1.identity_metadata.run_as as run_as,
    t1.usage_quantity * list_prices.pricing.default AS list_cost
  FROM
    system.billing.usage t1
    INNER JOIN system.billing.list_prices list_prices ON t1.cloud = list_prices.cloud
    AND t1.sku_name = list_prices.sku_name
    AND t1.usage_start_time >= list_prices.price_start_time
    AND (
      t1.usage_end_time <= list_prices.price_end_time
      or list_prices.price_end_time is NULL
    )
  WHERE
    t1.billing_origin_product = 'JOBS'
    AND t1.usage_metadata.job_id IS NOT NULL
    AND t1.usage_metadata.job_run_id IS NOT NULL
    AND t1.usage_date >= DATE_ADD(CURRENT_DATE(), -(:number_of_days * 2))
)
SELECT
  coalesce(t2.name, t1.job_id) as job_name,
  t1.workspace_id,
  t4.workspace_name,
  t1.job_id,
  ifnull(t3.team_name, 'unknown') as team_name,
  t1.sku_name,
  ifnull(
    {catalog}.{schema}.job_type_from_sku(t1.sku_name),
    'UNKNOWN'
  ) as job_type_from_sku,
  t1.run_as,
  Last7DaySpend as LastPeriodSpend,
  Last14DaySpend as OlderPeriodSpend,
  last7DaySpend - last14DaySpend as LastPeriodGrowth,
  ifnull(
    try_divide(
      (last7DaySpend - last14DaySpend),
      last14DaySpend
    ) * 100,
    100
  ) AS LastPeriodGrowthPct
FROM
  (
    SELECT
      workspace_id,
      job_id,
      run_as,
      sku_name,
      SUM(list_cost) AS spend,
      SUM(
        CASE
          WHEN usage_end_time BETWEEN date_add(current_date(), -(:number_of_days))
          AND date_add(current_date(), -1) THEN list_cost
          ELSE 0
        END
      ) AS Last7DaySpend,
      SUM(
        CASE
          WHEN usage_end_time BETWEEN date_add(current_date(), -(:number_of_days * 2))
          AND date_add(current_date(), -(:number_of_days + 1)) THEN list_cost
          ELSE 0
        END
      ) AS Last14DaySpend
    FROM
      job_run_timeline_with_cost
    GROUP BY
      ALL
  ) t1
  LEFT JOIN most_recent_jobs t2 USING (workspace_id, job_id)
  LEFT JOIN billing_jobs_w_org_team t3 USING (workspace_id, job_id)
  INNER JOIN {catalog}.{schema}.workspace_reference t4 USING (workspace_id)
ORDER BY
  LastPeriodGrowth DESC;

datasets.name: e4d4c1ff
datasets.query:
with most_recent_jobs as (
  SELECT
    *,
    ROW_NUMBER() OVER(
      PARTITION BY workspace_id,
      job_id
      ORDER BY
        change_time DESC
    ) as rn
  FROM
    system.lakeflow.jobs QUALIFY rn = 1
),
billing_data AS (
  SELECT
    workspace_id,
    job_id,
    list_cost,
    case
      when usage_end_time is null then null
      else FIRST_VALUE(sku_name) OVER (
        PARTITION BY job_id
        ORDER BY
          usage_end_time DESC
      )
    end AS recent_sku_name
  FROM
    (
      select
        t1.workspace_id,
        t1.usage_metadata.job_id as job_id,
        t1.usage_quantity * list_prices.pricing.default as list_cost,
        t1.sku_name,
        t1.usage_end_time
      from
        system.billing.usage t1
        INNER JOIN system.billing.list_prices list_prices on t1.cloud = list_prices.cloud
        and t1.sku_name = list_prices.sku_name
        and t1.usage_start_time >= list_prices.price_start_time
        and (
          t1.usage_end_time <= list_prices.price_end_time
          or list_prices.price_end_time is null
        )
      WHERE
        t1.billing_origin_product = 'JOBS'
        and t1.usage_metadata.job_id is not null
        AND usage_date >= CURRENT_DATE() - INTERVAL 30 DAYS
    )
),
agg_data as (
  SELECT
    t1.workspace_id,
    t1.job_id,
    SUM(list_cost) as list_cost,
    FIRST_VALUE(recent_sku_name) AS recent_sku_name
  FROM
    billing_data t1
  group by
    all
)
select
  most_recent_jobs.workspace_id,
  t1.workspace_name,
  coalesce(name, most_recent_jobs.job_id) as job_name,
  most_recent_jobs.job_id,
  sum(list_cost) as list_cost,
  first(recent_sku_name),
  ifnull(
    {catalog}.{schema}.job_type_from_sku(recent_sku_name),
    'UNKNOWN'
  ) as job_type_from_sku,
  any_value(tags) as tags,
  any_value(run_as) as run_as
from
  most_recent_jobs
  INNER JOIN {catalog}.{schema}.workspace_reference t1 USING (workspace_id)
  LEFT JOIN agg_data USING (workspace_id, job_id)
where
  cardinality(tags) = 0
group by
  all
order by
  list_cost desc;

datasets.query:
with most_recent_jobs as (
  SELECT
    *,
    ROW_NUMBER() OVER(
      PARTITION BY workspace_id,
      job_id
      ORDER BY
        change_time DESC
    ) as rn
  FROM
    system.lakeflow.jobs QUALIFY rn = 1
),
billing_w_org_team as (
  SELECT
    t1.*,
    {catalog}.{schema}.team_name_from_tags(t1.custom_tags, t2.tags) as team_name
  FROM
    system.billing.usage t1
    LEFT JOIN most_recent_jobs t2 ON t1.workspace_id = t2.workspace_id
    AND t1.usage_metadata.job_id = t2.job_id
),
list_cost_per_job as (
  SELECT
    t1.workspace_id,
    t1.usage_metadata.job_id,
    ifnull(
      {catalog}.{schema}.job_type_from_sku(t1.sku_name),
      'UNKNOWN'
    ) as job_type_from_sku,
    ifnull(t1.team_name, 'unknown') as team_name,
    COUNT(DISTINCT t1.usage_metadata.job_run_id) as runs,
    SUM(t1.usage_quantity * list_prices.pricing.default) as list_cost,
    first(identity_metadata.run_as, true) as run_as,
    first(t1.custom_tags, true) as custom_tags,
    MAX(t1.usage_end_time) as usage_end_time
  FROM
    billing_w_org_team t1
    INNER JOIN system.billing.list_prices list_prices on t1.cloud = list_prices.cloud
    and t1.sku_name = list_prices.sku_name
    and t1.usage_start_time >= list_prices.price_start_time
    and (
      t1.usage_end_time <= list_prices.price_end_time
      or list_prices.price_end_time is null
    )
  WHERE
    t1.billing_origin_product = 'JOBS'
    AND t1.usage_metadata.job_id IS NOT NULL
    AND t1.usage_date >= CURRENT_DATE() - INTERVAL 30 DAY
  GROUP BY
    ALL
)
SELECT
  coalesce(
    t2.name,
    t1.job_id
  ) as job_name,
  t1.job_id,
  t1.job_type_from_sku,
  t1.team_name,
  t1.workspace_id,
  t3.workspace_name,
  t1.runs,
  t1.run_as,
  SUM(list_cost) as list_cost,
  t1.usage_end_time
FROM
  list_cost_per_job t1
  LEFT JOIN most_recent_jobs t2 USING (workspace_id, job_id)
  INNER JOIN {catalog}.{schema}.workspace_reference t3 USING (workspace_id)
GROUP BY
  ALL
ORDER BY
  list_cost DESC;

datasets.name: 6e7c6490
datasets.query:
with job_run_timeline_with_cost as (
  SELECT
    t1.*,
    t1.identity_metadata.run_as as run_as,
    t2.job_id,
    t2.run_id,
    t2.result_state,
    t1.usage_quantity * list_prices.pricing.default as list_cost
  FROM
    system.billing.usage t1
    INNER JOIN system.lakeflow.job_run_timeline t2 ON t1.workspace_id = t2.workspace_id
    AND t1.usage_metadata.job_id = t2.job_id
    AND t1.usage_metadata.job_run_id = t2.run_id
    AND t1.usage_start_time >= date_trunc("Hour", t2.period_start_time)
    AND t1.usage_start_time < date_trunc("Hour", t2.period_end_time) + INTERVAL 1 HOUR
    INNER JOIN system.billing.list_prices list_prices on t1.cloud = list_prices.cloud
    and t1.sku_name = list_prices.sku_name
    and t1.usage_start_time >= list_prices.price_start_time
    and (
      t1.usage_end_time <= list_prices.price_end_time
      or list_prices.price_end_time is null
    )
  WHERE
    t1.billing_origin_product = 'JOBS'
    AND t1.usage_date >= CURRENT_DATE() - INTERVAL 30 DAYS
),
most_recent_jobs as (
  SELECT
    *,
    ROW_NUMBER() OVER(
      PARTITION BY workspace_id,
      job_id
      ORDER BY
        change_time DESC
    ) as rn
  FROM
    system.lakeflow.jobs QUALIFY rn = 1
),
cumulative_run_status_cost as (
  SELECT
    workspace_id,
    job_id,
    run_id,
    run_as,
    result_state,
    usage_end_time,
    case
      when usage_end_time is null then null
      else FIRST_VALUE(sku_name) OVER (
        PARTITION BY job_id
        ORDER BY
          usage_end_time DESC
      )
    end AS recent_sku_name,
    case
      when usage_end_time is null then null
      else FIRST_VALUE(
        {catalog}.{schema}.team_name_from_tags(custom_tags, tags)
      ) OVER (
        PARTITION BY job_id
        ORDER BY
          usage_end_time DESC
      )
    end AS recent_team_name,
    SUM(list_cost) OVER (
      ORDER BY
        workspace_id,
        job_id,
        run_id,
        usage_end_time ROWS BETWEEN UNBOUNDED PRECEDING
        AND CURRENT ROW
    ) AS cumulative_cost
  FROM
    (
      SELECT
        t1.workspace_id,
        t1.job_id,
        run_id,
        t1.run_as,
        result_state,
        usage_end_time,
        t1.sku_name,
        t1.list_cost,
        t1.usage_end_time,
        t1.custom_tags,
        t2.tags
      FROM
        job_run_timeline_with_cost t1
        LEFT JOIN most_recent_jobs t2 ON t1.workspace_id = t2.workspace_id
        AND t1.job_id = t2.job_id
    )
  ORDER BY
    workspace_id,
    job_id,
    run_id,
    usage_end_time
),
cost_per_status as (
  SELECT
    workspace_id,
    job_id,
    run_id,
    run_as,
    result_state,
    usage_end_time,
    recent_sku_name,
    recent_team_name,
    cumulative_cost - COALESCE(
      LAG(cumulative_cost) OVER (
        ORDER BY
          workspace_id,
          job_id,
          run_id,
          usage_end_time
      ),
      0
    ) AS result_state_cost
  FROM
    cumulative_run_status_cost
  WHERE
    result_state IS NOT NULL
  ORDER BY
    workspace_id,
    job_id,
    run_id,
    usage_end_time
),
cost_per_status_agg as (
  SELECT
    workspace_id,
    job_id,
    ifnull(first(recent_team_name), 'unknown') as team_name,
    ifnull(
      {catalog}.{schema}.job_type_from_sku(first(recent_sku_name)),
      'UNKNOWN'
    ) as job_type_from_sku,
    FIRST(run_as, TRUE) as run_as,
    SUM(result_state_cost) as list_cost
  FROM
    cost_per_status
  WHERE
    result_state IN ('ERROR', 'FAILED', 'TIMED_OUT')
  GROUP BY
    ALL
),
terminal_statues as (
  SELECT
    workspace_id,
    job_id,
    CASE
      WHEN result_state IN ('ERROR', 'FAILED', 'TIMED_OUT') THEN 1
      ELSE 0
    END as is_failure,
    period_end_time as last_seen_date
  FROM
    system.lakeflow.job_run_timeline
  WHERE
    result_state IS NOT NULL
    AND period_end_time >= CURRENT_DATE() - INTERVAL 30 DAYS
)
SELECT
  coalesce(first(t2.name), t1.job_id) as job_name,
  t1.workspace_id,
  t5.workspace_name,
  t1.job_id,
  ifnull(first(t3.job_type_from_sku), 'UNKNOWN') as job_type_from_sku,
  ifnull(first(t3.team_name), 'unknown') as team_name,
  COUNT(*) as runs,
  t3.run_as,
  SUM(is_failure) as failures,
  (
    1 - COALESCE(try_divide(SUM(is_failure), COUNT(*)), 0)
  ) * 100 as success_ratio,
  first(t3.list_cost) as failure_list_cost,
  MAX(t1.last_seen_date) as last_seen_date
FROM
  terminal_statues t1
  LEFT JOIN most_recent_jobs t2 USING (workspace_id, job_id)
  LEFT JOIN cost_per_status_agg t3 USING (workspace_id, job_id)
  INNER JOIN {catalog}.{schema}.workspace_reference t5 USING (workspace_id)
GROUP BY
  ALL
ORDER BY
  failures DESC;

datasets.name: a166c847
datasets.query:
with job_run_timeline_with_cost as (
  SELECT
    t1.*,
    t2.job_id,
    t2.run_id,
    t1.identity_metadata.run_as as run_as,
    t2.result_state,
    t1.usage_quantity * list_prices.pricing.default as list_cost
  FROM
    system.billing.usage t1
    INNER JOIN system.lakeflow.job_run_timeline t2 ON t1.workspace_id = t2.workspace_id
    AND t1.usage_metadata.job_id = t2.job_id
    AND t1.usage_metadata.job_run_id = t2.run_id
    AND t1.usage_start_time >= date_trunc("Hour", t2.period_start_time)
    AND t1.usage_start_time < date_trunc("Hour", t2.period_end_time) + INTERVAL 1 HOUR
    INNER JOIN system.billing.list_prices list_prices on t1.cloud = list_prices.cloud
    and t1.sku_name = list_prices.sku_name
    and t1.usage_start_time >= list_prices.price_start_time
    and (
      t1.usage_end_time <= list_prices.price_end_time
      or list_prices.price_end_time is null
    )
  WHERE
    t1.billing_origin_product = 'JOBS'
    AND t1.usage_date >= CURRENT_DATE() - INTERVAL 30 DAYS
),
most_recent_jobs as (
  SELECT
    *,
    ROW_NUMBER() OVER(
      PARTITION BY workspace_id,
      job_id
      ORDER BY
        change_time DESC
    ) as rn
  FROM
    system.lakeflow.jobs QUALIFY rn = 1
),
cumulative_run_status_cost as (
  SELECT
    workspace_id,
    job_id,
    run_id,
    run_as,
    result_state,
    usage_end_time,
    case
      when usage_end_time is null then null
      else FIRST_VALUE(sku_name) OVER (
        PARTITION BY job_id
        ORDER BY
          usage_end_time DESC
      )
    end AS recent_sku_name,
    case
      when usage_end_time is null then null
      else FIRST_VALUE(
        {catalog}.{schema}.team_name_from_tags(custom_tags, tags)
      ) OVER (
        PARTITION BY job_id
        ORDER BY
          usage_end_time DESC
      )
    end AS recent_team_name,
    SUM(list_cost) OVER (
      ORDER BY
        workspace_id,
        job_id,
        run_id,
        usage_end_time ROWS BETWEEN UNBOUNDED PRECEDING
        AND CURRENT ROW
    ) AS cumulative_cost
  FROM
    (
      SELECT
        t1.workspace_id,
        t1.job_id,
        run_id,
        t1.run_as,
        result_state,
        usage_end_time,
        t1.sku_name,
        t1.list_cost,
        t1.usage_end_time,
        t1.custom_tags,
        t2.tags
      FROM
        job_run_timeline_with_cost t1
        LEFT JOIN most_recent_jobs t2 ON t1.workspace_id = t2.workspace_id
        AND t1.job_id = t2.job_id
    )
  ORDER BY
    workspace_id,
    job_id,
    run_id,
    usage_end_time
),
cost_per_status as (
  SELECT
    workspace_id,
    job_id,
    run_id,
    run_as,
    result_state,
    usage_end_time,
    recent_sku_name,
    recent_team_name,
    cumulative_cost - COALESCE(
      LAG(cumulative_cost) OVER (
        ORDER BY
          workspace_id,
          job_id,
          run_id,
          usage_end_time
      ),
      0
    ) AS result_state_cost
  FROM
    cumulative_run_status_cost
  WHERE
    result_state IS NOT NULL
  ORDER BY
    workspace_id,
    job_id,
    run_id,
    usage_end_time
),
cost_per_unsuccesful_status_agg as (
  SELECT
    workspace_id,
    job_id,
    run_id,
    ifnull(first(recent_team_name), 'unknown') as team_name,
    ifnull(
      {catalog}.{schema}.job_type_from_sku(first(recent_sku_name)),
      'UNKNOWN'
    ) as job_type_from_sku,
    first(run_as, TRUE) as run_as,
    last(usage_end_time) as usage_end_time,
    SUM(result_state_cost) as list_cost
  FROM
    cost_per_status
  WHERE
    result_state != "SUCCEEDED"
  GROUP BY
    ALL
),
repaired_runs as (
  SELECT
    workspace_id,
    job_id,
    run_id,
    COUNT(*) as cnt
  FROM
    system.lakeflow.job_run_timeline
  WHERE
    result_state IS NOT NULL
  GROUP BY
    ALL
  HAVING
    cnt > 1
),
successful_repairs as (
  SELECT
    t1.workspace_id,
    t1.job_id,
    t1.run_id,
    MAX(t1.period_end_time) as period_end_time
  FROM
    system.lakeflow.job_run_timeline t1
    JOIN repaired_runs t2 ON t1.workspace_id = t2.workspace_id
    AND t1.job_id = t2.job_id
    AND t1.run_id = t2.run_id
  WHERE
    t1.result_state = "SUCCEEDED"
  GROUP BY
    ALL
),
combined_repairs as (
  SELECT
    t1.*,
    t2.period_end_time,
    t1.cnt as repairs
  FROM
    repaired_runs t1
    LEFT JOIN successful_repairs t2 USING (workspace_id, job_id, run_id)
)
SELECT
  coalesce(last(t3.name), t1.job_id) as job_name,
  t1.workspace_id,
  t6.workspace_name,
  t1.job_id,
  t1.run_id,
  max(t2.period_end_time) as last_seen_date,
  ifnull(first(t4.job_type_from_sku), 'UNKNOWN') as job_type_from_sku,
  ifnull(first(t4.team_name), 'unknown') as team_name,
  first(t4.run_as, TRUE) as run_as,
  first(t1.repairs) - 1 as repairs,
  first(t4.list_cost) as repair_list_cost,
  CASE
    WHEN t1.period_end_time IS NOT NULL THEN CAST(
      t1.period_end_time - MIN(t2.period_end_time) as LONG
    )
    ELSE NULL
  END AS repair_time_seconds
FROM
  combined_repairs t1
  JOIN system.lakeflow.job_run_timeline t2 USING (workspace_id, job_id, run_id)
  LEFT JOIN most_recent_jobs t3 USING (workspace_id, job_id)
  LEFT JOIN cost_per_unsuccesful_status_agg t4 USING (workspace_id, job_id, run_id)
  INNER JOIN {catalog}.{schema}.workspace_reference t6 USING (workspace_id)
WHERE
  t2.result_state IS NOT NULL
GROUP BY
  t1.workspace_id,
  t6.workspace_name,
  t1.job_id,
  t1.run_id,
  t1.period_end_time
ORDER BY
  repairs DESC;

datasets.name: 8cd4b39f
datasets.query:
with most_recent_jobs as (
  SELECT
    *,
    ROW_NUMBER() OVER(
      PARTITION BY workspace_id,
      job_id
      ORDER BY
        change_time DESC
    ) as rn
  FROM
    system.lakeflow.jobs QUALIFY rn = 1
),
billing_w_team as (
  SELECT
    t1.*,
    {catalog}.{schema}.team_name_from_tags(t1.custom_tags, t2.tags) as team_name
  FROM
    system.billing.usage t1
    LEFT JOIN most_recent_jobs t2 ON t1.workspace_id = t2.workspace_id
    AND t1.usage_metadata.job_id = t2.job_id
),
stats_per_job_run as (
  SELECT
    t1.workspace_id,
    t1.usage_metadata.job_id,
    t1.usage_metadata.job_run_id as run_id,
    max(t1.team_name) as team_name,
    SUM(t1.usage_quantity * list_prices.pricing.default) as list_cost,
    first(t1.sku_name, true) as sku_name,
    first(identity_metadata.run_as, true) as run_as,
    first(t1.custom_tags, true) as custom_tags,
    MAX(t1.usage_end_time) as last_seen,
    MIN(t1.usage_start_time) as first_seen
  FROM
    billing_w_team t1
    INNER JOIN system.billing.list_prices list_prices on t1.cloud = list_prices.cloud
    and t1.sku_name = list_prices.sku_name
    and t1.usage_start_time >= list_prices.price_start_time
    and (
      t1.usage_end_time <= list_prices.price_end_time
      or list_prices.price_end_time is null
    )
  WHERE
    t1.billing_origin_product = 'JOBS'
    AND t1.usage_metadata.job_id IS NOT NULL
    AND t1.usage_metadata.job_run_id IS NOT NULL
    AND t1.usage_start_time >= CURRENT_DATE() - INTERVAL 30 DAY
  GROUP BY
    1,
    2,
    3
),
stats_per_job AS (
  SELECT
    workspace_id,
    job_id,
    ifnull(
      {catalog}.{schema}.job_type_from_sku(sku_name),
      'UNKNOWN'
    ) as job_type_from_sku,
    ifnull(max(team_name), 'unknown') as team_name,
    COUNT(run_id) AS runs,
    SUM(list_cost) AS total_list_cost,
    AVG(list_cost) AS avg_list_cost,
    MAX(list_cost) AS max_list_cost,
    percentile(list_cost, 0.9) AS p90,
    last_seen as last_seen_date
  FROM
    stats_per_job_run
  WHERE
    first_seen > CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 30 DAYS
  GROUP BY
    ALL
  ORDER BY
    total_list_cost DESC
)
SELECT
  t1.*,
  t2.workspace_name,
  coalesce(t3.name, t1.job_id) as job_name,
  (max_list_cost - p90) AS list_cost_deviation_from_p90
FROM
  stats_per_job t1
  INNER JOIN {catalog}.{schema}.workspace_reference t2 USING (workspace_id)
  LEFT JOIN most_recent_jobs t3 USING (workspace_id, job_id)
ORDER BY
  list_cost_deviation_from_p90 DESC;

datasets.name: 1e4e16c0
datasets.query:
with most_recent_jobs as (
  SELECT
    *,
    ROW_NUMBER() OVER(
      PARTITION BY workspace_id,
      job_id
      ORDER BY
        change_time DESC
    ) as rn
  FROM
    system.lakeflow.jobs QUALIFY rn = 1
),
billing_w_team as (
  SELECT
    t1.*,
    {catalog}.{schema}.team_name_from_tags(t1.custom_tags, t2.tags) as team_name,
    t1.usage_metadata.job_id as job_id,
    t1.usage_metadata.job_run_id as run_id
  FROM
    system.billing.usage t1
    LEFT JOIN most_recent_jobs t2 ON t1.workspace_id = t2.workspace_id
    AND t1.usage_metadata.job_id = t2.job_id
  WHERE usage_date between current_date() - INTERVAL 180 DAY and current_date() - INTERVAL 1 DAY
),
jobs_usage as (
  SELECT
    t1.*,
    FIRST_VALUE(t1.sku_name) OVER (
      PARTITION BY t1.job_id
      ORDER BY
        t1.usage_end_time DESC ROWS BETWEEN UNBOUNDED PRECEDING
        AND UNBOUNDED FOLLOWING
    ) AS recent_sku_name,
    FIRST_VALUE(t1.team_name) OVER (
      PARTITION BY t1.job_id
      ORDER BY
        t1.usage_end_time DESC ROWS BETWEEN UNBOUNDED PRECEDING
        AND UNBOUNDED FOLLOWING
    ) AS recent_team_name
  FROM
    billing_w_team t1
  WHERE
    t1.billing_origin_product = 'JOBS'
),
usage_per_job as (
  SELECT
    t1.workspace_id,
    t1.job_id,
    t1.run_id,
    FIRST(t1.recent_sku_name) as sku_name,
    FIRST(t1.recent_team_name) as team_name
  FROM
    jobs_usage t1
  group by
    all
),
date_ranges AS (
    SELECT 
        workspace_id,
        job_id,
        run_id,
        CAST(period_start_time AS DATE) AS start_date,
        CAST(period_end_time AS DATE) AS end_date,
        period_start_time,
        period_end_time
    FROM system.lakeflow.job_run_timeline
    WHERE period_start_time >= current_date() - INTERVAL 180 DAY
    and period_end_time <= current_date() - INTERVAL 1 DAY
),
expanded_dates AS (
    SELECT
        workspace_id,
        job_id,
        run_id,
        EXPLODE(SEQUENCE(start_date, end_date)) AS job_date,
        period_start_time,
        period_end_time
    FROM date_ranges
),
job_durations AS (
    SELECT 
        workspace_id,
        job_id,
        run_id,
        job_date,
        CASE 
            WHEN job_date = CAST(period_start_time AS DATE) THEN period_start_time
            ELSE CAST(job_date AS TIMESTAMP)
        END AS actual_start_time,
        CASE 
            WHEN job_date = CAST(period_end_time AS DATE) THEN period_end_time
            ELSE CAST(job_date AS TIMESTAMP) + INTERVAL 1 DAY - INTERVAL 1 SECOND
        END AS actual_end_time
    FROM expanded_dates
),
timed_job_runs AS (
SELECT 
    workspace_id,
    job_id,
    run_id,
    job_date,
    UNIX_TIMESTAMP(actual_end_time) - UNIX_TIMESTAMP(actual_start_time) AS duration_in_seconds
FROM job_durations
)
SELECT
  t1.workspace_id,
  t3.workspace_name,
  t1.job_id,
  t1.run_id,
  coalesce(t4.name, t1.job_id) as job_name,
  ifnull(t2.sku_name, 'Unbilled') as sku_name,
  ifnull(
    {catalog}.{schema}.job_type_from_sku(t2.sku_name),
    'UNKNOWN'
  ) as job_type_from_sku,
  ifnull(t2.team_name, 'unknown') as team_name,
  t1.job_date,
  t1.duration_in_seconds as job_duration_in_secs
FROM
  timed_job_runs t1
  LEFT JOIN usage_per_job t2 USING (workspace_id, job_id, run_id)
  INNER JOIN {catalog}.{schema}.workspace_reference t3 USING (workspace_id)
  LEFT JOIN most_recent_jobs t4 USING (workspace_id, job_id)
WHERE
  date(t1.job_date) < current_date();

datasets.name: 9bbfcd27
datasets.query:
with most_recent_jobs as (
  SELECT
    *,
    ROW_NUMBER() OVER(
      PARTITION BY workspace_id,
      job_id
      ORDER BY
        change_time DESC
    ) as rn
  FROM
    system.lakeflow.jobs QUALIFY rn = 1
),
billing_w_org_team as (
  SELECT
    t1.*,
    {catalog}.{schema}.team_name_from_tags(t1.custom_tags, t2.tags) as team_name
  FROM
    system.billing.usage t1
    LEFT JOIN most_recent_jobs t2 ON t1.workspace_id = t2.workspace_id
    AND t1.usage_metadata.job_id = t2.job_id
),
job_run_timeline_with_cost as (
  SELECT
    t1.cloud,
    t1.workspace_id,
    t2.job_id,
    ifnull(
      {catalog}.{schema}.job_type_from_sku(t1.sku_name),
      'UNKNOWN'
    ) as job_type_from_sku,
    ifnull(t1.team_name, 'unknown') as team_name,
    t2.run_id,
    t2.result_state,
    t1.usage_start_time,
    t1.usage_end_time,
    t1.sku_name,
    t1.usage_unit,
    t1.usage_quantity,
    t1.usage_quantity * list_prices.pricing.default AS list_cost
  FROM
    billing_w_org_team t1
    INNER JOIN system.lakeflow.job_run_timeline t2 ON t1.workspace_id = t2.workspace_id
    AND t1.usage_metadata.job_id = t2.job_id
    AND t1.usage_metadata.job_run_id = t2.run_id
    AND t1.usage_start_time >= date_trunc("Hour", t2.period_start_time)
    AND t1.usage_start_time < date_trunc("Hour", t2.period_end_time) + INTERVAL 1 HOUR
    INNER JOIN system.billing.list_prices list_prices ON t1.cloud = list_prices.cloud
    AND t1.sku_name = list_prices.sku_name
    AND t1.usage_start_time >= list_prices.price_start_time
    AND (
      t1.usage_end_time <= list_prices.price_end_time
      or list_prices.price_end_time is NULL
    )
  WHERE
    t1.billing_origin_product = 'JOBS'
),
cumulative_run_status_cost as (
  SELECT
    workspace_id,
    job_id,
    run_id,
    result_state,
    usage_start_time,
    usage_end_time,
    job_type_from_sku,
    team_name,
    SUM(list_cost) OVER (
      partition by job_type_from_sku,
      team_name
      ORDER BY
        workspace_id,
        job_id,
        run_id,
        usage_end_time ROWS BETWEEN UNBOUNDED PRECEDING
        AND CURRENT ROW
    ) AS cumulative_cost
  FROM
    job_run_timeline_with_cost
  ORDER BY
    workspace_id,
    job_id,
    run_id,
    usage_end_time
),
final_data as (
  SELECT
    workspace_id,
    job_id,
    job_type_from_sku,
    team_name,
    run_id,
    result_state,
    usage_start_time,
    usage_end_time,
    cumulative_cost - COALESCE(
      LAG(cumulative_cost) OVER (
        partition by job_type_from_sku,
        team_name
        ORDER BY
          workspace_id,
          job_id,
          run_id,
          usage_end_time
      ),
      0
    ) AS result_state_cost
  FROM
    cumulative_run_status_cost
  WHERE
    result_state IS NOT NULL
)
select
  t1.*,
  t2.workspace_name,
  coalesce(t4.name, t1.job_id) as job_name
from
  final_data t1

datasets.name: fe4804e7
datasets.query:
with most_recent_jobs as (
  SELECT
    *,
    ROW_NUMBER() OVER(
      PARTITION BY workspace_id,
      job_id
      ORDER BY
        change_time DESC
    ) as rn
  FROM
    system.lakeflow.jobs QUALIFY rn = 1
),
billing_jobs_w_org_team as (
  SELECT
    workspace_id,
    job_id,
    ifnull(first(recent_team_name), 'unknown') as team_name,
    first(recent_sku_name) as sku_name
  FROM
    (
      SELECT
        workspace_id,
        job_id,
        case
          when usage_end_time is null then null
          else FIRST_VALUE(sku_name) OVER (
            PARTITION BY job_id
            ORDER BY
              usage_end_time DESC
          )
        end AS recent_sku_name,
        case
          when usage_end_time is null then null
          else FIRST_VALUE(
            {catalog}.{schema}.team_name_from_tags(custom_tags, tags)
          ) OVER (
            PARTITION BY job_id
            ORDER BY
              usage_end_time DESC
          )
        end AS recent_team_name
      FROM
        (
          select
            coalesce(t1.workspace_id, t2.workspace_id) as workspace_id,
            coalesce(t1.usage_metadata.job_id, t2.job_id) as job_id,
            t1.sku_name,
            t1.usage_end_time,
            t1.custom_tags,
            t2.tags
          FROM
            system.billing.usage t1
            LEFT JOIN most_recent_jobs t2 ON t1.workspace_id = t2.workspace_id
            AND t1.usage_metadata.job_id = t2.job_id
        )
    )
  group by
    all
),
job_run_duration as (
  SELECT
    workspace_id,
    job_id,
    run_id,
    CAST(SUM(period_end_time - period_start_time) AS LONG) as duration
  FROM
    system.lakeflow.job_run_timeline
  WHERE
    period_start_time > CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 30 DAYS
  GROUP BY
    ALL
)
SELECT
  t1.workspace_id,
  t1.job_id,
  t3.workspace_name,
  coalesce(t4.name, t1.job_id) as job_name,
  ifnull(
    {catalog}.{schema}.job_type_from_sku(t2.sku_name),
    'UNKNOWN'
  ) as job_type_from_sku,
  ifnull(t2.team_name, 'unknown') as team_name,
  COUNT(DISTINCT t1.run_id) as runs,
  MEAN(t1.duration) as mean_seconds,
  AVG(t1.duration) as avg_seconds,
  PERCENTILE(t1.duration, 0.9) as p90_seconds,
  PERCENTILE(t1.duration, 0.95) as p95_seconds
FROM
  job_run_duration t1
  LEFT JOIN billing_jobs_w_org_team t2 USING (workspace_id, job_id)
  INNER JOIN {catalog}.{schema}.workspace_reference t3 USING (workspace_id)
  LEFT JOIN most_recent_jobs t4 USING (workspace_id, job_id)
GROUP BY
  ALL
ORDER BY
  mean_seconds DESC
LIMIT
  10;

datasets.name: 9f1b61ef
datasets.query:
with most_recent_jobs as (
  SELECT
    *,
    ROW_NUMBER() OVER(
      PARTITION BY workspace_id,
      job_id
      ORDER BY
        change_time DESC
    ) as rn
  FROM
    system.lakeflow.jobs QUALIFY rn = 1
),
billing_w_org_team as (
  SELECT
    *,
    case
      when usage_end_time is null then null
      else FIRST_VALUE(sku_name) OVER (
        PARTITION BY job_id
        ORDER BY
          usage_end_time DESC
      )
    end AS recent_sku_name,
    case
      when usage_end_time is null then null
      else FIRST_VALUE(
        {catalog}.{schema}.team_name_from_tags(custom_tags, tags)
      ) OVER (
        PARTITION BY job_id
        ORDER BY
          usage_end_time DESC
      )
    end AS recent_team_name
  FROM
    (
      SELECT
        t1.*,
        t1.usage_metadata.job_id as job_id,
        t1.sku_name,
        t1.usage_end_time,
        t1.custom_tags,
        t2.tags
      FROM
        system.billing.usage t1
        LEFT JOIN most_recent_jobs t2 ON t1.workspace_id = t2.workspace_id
        AND t1.usage_metadata.job_id = t2.job_id
    )
),
list_cost_per_job_cluster as (
  SELECT
    t1.workspace_id,
    t1.usage_metadata.job_id,
    t1.usage_metadata.cluster_id,
    first(t1.recent_team_name) as team_name,
    ifnull(
      {catalog}.{schema}.job_type_from_sku(first(t1.recent_sku_name)),
      'UNKNOWN'
    ) as job_type_from_sku,
    COUNT(DISTINCT t1.usage_metadata.job_run_id) as runs,
    SUM(t1.usage_quantity * list_prices.pricing.default) as list_cost,
    first(identity_metadata.run_as, true) as run_as,
    first(t1.custom_tags, true) as custom_tags,
    MAX(t1.usage_end_time) as last_seen_date
  FROM
    billing_w_org_team t1
    INNER JOIN system.billing.list_prices list_prices on t1.cloud = list_prices.cloud
    and t1.sku_name = list_prices.sku_name
    and t1.usage_start_time >= list_prices.price_start_time
    and (
      t1.usage_end_time <= list_prices.price_end_time
      or list_prices.price_end_time is null
    )
  WHERE
    t1.billing_origin_product = 'JOBS'
    AND t1.usage_metadata.job_id IS NOT NULL
    AND t1.usage_date >= CURRENT_DATE() - INTERVAL 30 DAY
  GROUP BY
    ALL
),
jobsrollingmonth as (
  SELECT
    t2.name,
    t1.job_id,
    t1.workspace_id,
    t1.cluster_id,
    ifnull(first(t1.team_name), 'unknown') as team_name,
    ifnull(first(t1.job_type_from_sku), 'UNKNOWN') as job_type_from_sku,
    t1.runs,
    t1.run_as,
    SUM(list_cost) as list_cost,
    t1.last_seen_date
  FROM
    list_cost_per_job_cluster t1
    LEFT JOIN most_recent_jobs t2 USING (workspace_id, job_id)
  GROUP BY
    ALL
  ORDER BY
    list_cost DESC
),
clusterutil as (
  SELECT
    *
  from
    system.compute.node_timeline
  WHERE
    start_time >= CURRENT_DATE() - INTERVAL 30 DAY
),
jobswithutil as (
  select
    jobsrollingmonth.workspace_id,
    jobsrollingmonth.job_id,
    coalesce(jobsrollingmonth.name, jobsrollingmonth.job_id) as job_name,
    max(jobsrollingmonth.team_name) as team_name,
    max(jobsrollingmonth.job_type_from_sku) as job_type_from_sku,
    avg(cpu_user_percent + cpu_system_percent) as `Avg CPU Utilization`,
    100 - avg(cpu_user_percent + cpu_system_percent) as `Avg Unutilized CPU`,
    max(cpu_user_percent + cpu_system_percent) as `Peak CPU Utilization`,
    avg(cpu_wait_percent) as `Avg CPU Disk Wait`,
    max(cpu_wait_percent) as `Max CPU Disk Wait`,
    avg(mem_used_percent) as `Avg Memory Utilization`,
    max(mem_used_percent) as `Max Memory Utilization`
  from
    clusterutil
    join jobsrollingmonth on clusterutil.cluster_id = jobsrollingmonth.cluster_id
  where
    jobsrollingmonth.name is not null
  group by
    1,
    2,
    3
)
select
  t1.*,
  t3.workspace_name
from
  jobswithutil t1
  INNER JOIN {catalog}.{schema}.workspace_reference t3 USING (workspace_id)
order by
  `Avg Memory Utilization`;

datasets.name: 747b8e0e
datasets.query:
with clusters AS (
  SELECT
    *,
    ROW_NUMBER() OVER(
      PARTITION BY workspace_id,
      cluster_id
      ORDER BY
        change_time DESC
    ) as rn
  FROM
    system.compute.clusters
  WHERE
    cluster_source = "UI" QUALIFY rn = 1
),
job_tasks_exploded AS (
  SELECT
    workspace_id,
    job_id,
    EXPLODE(compute_ids) as cluster_id
  FROM
    system.lakeflow.job_task_run_timeline
  WHERE
    period_start_time >= CURRENT_DATE() - INTERVAL 30 DAY
),
all_purpose_cluster_jobs AS (
  SELECT
    t1.*,
    t2.cluster_name,
    t2.owned_by,
    t2.dbr_version
  FROM
    job_tasks_exploded t1
    INNER JOIN clusters t2 USING (workspace_id, cluster_id)
),
most_recent_jobs as (
  SELECT
    *,
    ROW_NUMBER() OVER(
      PARTITION BY workspace_id,
      job_id
      ORDER BY
        change_time DESC
    ) as rn
  FROM
    system.lakeflow.jobs QUALIFY rn = 1
),
billing_jobs_w_org_team as (
  SELECT
    workspace_id,
    job_id,
    ifnull(first(recent_team_name), 'unknown') as team_name,
    ifnull(
      {catalog}.{schema}.job_type_from_sku(first(recent_sku_name)),
      'UNKNOWN'
    ) as job_type_from_sku
  FROM
    (
      SELECT
        workspace_id,
        job_id,
        case
          when usage_end_time is null then null
          else FIRST_VALUE(sku_name) OVER (
            PARTITION BY job_id
            ORDER BY
              usage_end_time DESC
          )
        end AS recent_sku_name,
        case
          when usage_end_time is null then null
          else FIRST_VALUE(
            {catalog}.{schema}.team_name_from_tags(custom_tags, tags)
          ) OVER (
            PARTITION BY job_id
            ORDER BY
              usage_end_time DESC
          )
        end AS recent_team_name
      FROM
        (
          select
            coalesce(t1.workspace_id, t2.workspace_id) as workspace_id,
            coalesce(t1.usage_metadata.job_id, t2.job_id) as job_id,
            t1.sku_name,
            t1.usage_end_time,
            t1.custom_tags,
            t2.tags
          FROM
            system.billing.usage t1 FULL
            OUTER JOIN most_recent_jobs t2 ON t1.workspace_id = t2.workspace_id
            AND t1.usage_metadata.job_id = t2.job_id
        )
    )
  group by
    all
)
SELECT
  t1.workspace_id,
  t4.workspace_name,
  t1.job_id,
  coalesce(first(t2.name, TRUE), t1.job_id) as job_name,
  ifnull(first(t3.team_name), 'unknown') as team_name,
  ifnull(first(t3.job_type_from_sku), 'UNKNOWN') as job_type_from_sku,
  array_size(collect_list(t1.cluster_id)) as task_runs,
  collect_set(
    named_struct(
      'cluster_id',
      t1.cluster_id,
      'cluster_name',
      t1.cluster_name
    )
  ) as clusters_list
FROM
  all_purpose_cluster_jobs t1
  LEFT JOIN most_recent_jobs t2 USING (workspace_id, job_id)
  LEFT JOIN billing_jobs_w_org_team t3 USING (workspace_id, job_id)
  INNER JOIN {catalog}.{schema}.workspace_reference t4 USING (workspace_id)
GROUP BY
  t1.workspace_id,
  t4.workspace_name,
  t1.job_id
ORDER BY
  task_runs DESC;

datasets.name: 38f9cb3c
datasets.query:
WITH most_recent_jobs as (
  SELECT
    *,
    ROW_NUMBER() OVER(
      PARTITION BY workspace_id,
      job_id
      ORDER BY
        change_time DESC
    ) as rn
  FROM
    system.lakeflow.jobs QUALIFY rn = 1
),
job_billing AS (
  SELECT
    workspace_id,
    workspace_name,
    job_id,
    job_name,
    case
      when usage_end_time is null then null
      else FIRST_VALUE(sku_name) OVER (
        PARTITION BY job_id
        ORDER BY
          usage_end_time DESC
      )
    end AS recent_sku_name,
    case
      when usage_end_time is null then null
      else FIRST_VALUE(
        {catalog}.{schema}.team_name_from_tags(custom_tags, tags)
      ) OVER (
        PARTITION BY job_id
        ORDER BY
          usage_end_time DESC
      )
    end AS recent_team_name,
    usage_date,
    list_cost
  FROM
    (
      select
        t1.workspace_id,
        t2.workspace_name,
        t1.usage_metadata.job_id as job_id,
        coalesce(t3.name, t1.usage_metadata.job_id) as job_name,
        t1.usage_quantity * list_prices.pricing.default as list_cost,
        t1.sku_name,
        t1.usage_end_time,
        t1.usage_date,
        custom_tags,
        tags
      from
        system.billing.usage t1
        INNER JOIN system.billing.list_prices list_prices ON t1.cloud = list_prices.cloud
        AND t1.sku_name = list_prices.sku_name
        AND t1.usage_start_time >= list_prices.price_start_time
        AND (
          t1.usage_end_time <= list_prices.price_end_time
          or list_prices.price_end_time is NULL
        )
        INNER JOIN {catalog}.{schema}.workspace_reference t2 USING (workspace_id)
        LEFT JOIN most_recent_jobs t3 ON t1.workspace_id = t3.workspace_id
        AND t1.usage_metadata.job_id = t3.job_id
      WHERE
        t1.billing_origin_product = 'JOBS'
        and t1.usage_metadata.job_id is not null
        AND usage_date >= CURRENT_DATE() - INTERVAL 30 DAYS
    )
),
agg_cost AS (
  SELECT
    t1.workspace_id,
    t1.workspace_name,
    t1.job_id,
    t1.job_name,
    ifnull(first(recent_team_name), 'unknown') as team_name,
    ifnull(
      {catalog}.{schema}.job_type_from_sku(first(recent_sku_name)),
      'UNKNOWN'
    ) as job_type_from_sku,
    sum(list_cost) as list_cost
  FROM
    job_billing t1
  GROUP BY
    ALL
),
read_tables AS (
  SELECT
    DISTINCT source_table_full_name AS used_dataset
  FROM
    system.access.table_lineage
  WHERE
    source_table_full_name IS NOT NULL
    AND event_date > CURRENT_DATE() - INTERVAL 30 DAY
),
job_tables AS (
  SELECT
    workspace_id,
    entity_id as job_id,
    created_by,
    target_table_full_name AS dataset,
    CASE
      WHEN target_table_full_name IN (
        SELECT
          used_dataset
        FROM
          read_tables
      ) THEN 'used_datasets'
      ELSE 'unused_datasets'
    END AS dataset_status
  FROM
    system.access.table_lineage
  WHERE
    target_table_full_name IS NOT NULL
    AND entity_type = 'JOB'
    AND entity_id IS NOT NULL
    AND entity_id <> ''
    AND event_date > CURRENT_DATE() - INTERVAL 30 DAY
),
dataset_array AS (
  SELECT
    workspace_id,
    job_id,
    ARRAY_DISTINCT(COLLECT_LIST(created_by)) AS created_by,
    ARRAY_DISTINCT(
      COLLECT_LIST(
        CASE
          WHEN dataset_status = 'used_datasets' THEN dataset
        END
      )
    ) AS used_datasets,
    ARRAY_DISTINCT(
      COLLECT_LIST(
        CASE
          WHEN dataset_status = 'unused_datasets' THEN dataset
        END
      )
    ) AS unused_datasets
  FROM
    job_tables
  GROUP BY
    all
),
final_data AS (
  SELECT
    t1.*,
    t2.workspace_name,
    t2.job_name,
    ifnull(t2.team_name, 'unknown') as team_name,
    ifnull(t2.job_type_from_sku, 'UNKNOWN') as job_type_from_sku,
    t2.list_cost,
    size(t1.unused_datasets) as no_of_unused_datasets
  from
    dataset_array t1
    LEFT JOIN agg_cost t2 USING (workspace_id, job_id)
)
select
  *
from
  final_data
where
  no_of_unused_datasets > 0
  and list_cost IS NOT NULL
order by
  list_cost desc;

Valores positivos indican aumento de costos, negativos indican reducción. Útil para detectar si los costos de jobs están acelerándose o estabilizándose.

widget.name: e8fc41c4
widget.textbox_spec:
### Dashboard de Costos, Operaciones y Rendimiento de Clusters para Jobs
----
Este dashboard integral proporciona información sobre costos de jobs, operaciones y utilización de recursos, permitiendo a los equipos monitorear, analizar y optimizar el rendimiento y gasto relacionado con jobs. El dashboard está organizado en cuatro secciones, cada una mejorada por filtros globales que aplican a través de todas las secciones, permitiendo análisis personalizado y granular.

#### Filtros del Dashboard

- **Rango de Fechas**: Selecciona un rango de fechas específico para enfocarse en actividad y gasto de jobs reciente o histórico, permitiendo análisis flexible basado en tiempo a través de costos, operaciones y uso de recursos.

- **Nombre del Workspace**: Filtra por workspace para ver métricas relacionadas con jobs específicas de workspaces individuales, dando a los equipos una vista clara de actividad de jobs e impacto de costos a nivel de workspace.

- **Tipo de Job**: Filtra los datos por tipos específicos de SKU de job (ej., serverless o classic) para analizar variaciones de costo y rendimiento basadas en el tipo de SKU del job.

- **ID de Job y Nombre de Job**: Filtra datos por ID de job o nombre de job para analizar métricas específicas de jobs individuales, permitiendo troubleshooting detallado o revisión de rendimiento de workflows particulares.

- **Nombre del Equipo**: Filtra por equipo para atribuir costos de jobs, uso de recursos e información operacional a equipos específicos, ayudando en responsabilidad y esfuerzos de optimización basados en equipo.

#### Secciones del Dashboard

1. **Desglose de Costos y Análisis de Uso**: Visualizaciones y tablas proporcionando desgloses de costos diarios relacionados con jobs por workspace, SKU, equipo y usuario, junto con información sobre jobs de alto costo. Esta sección ayuda a rastrear patrones de gasto e identificar principales impulsores de costos.

2. **Comparación de Costos y Análisis de Cambios**: Permite comparación de costos sobre marcos de tiempo personalizables, proporcionando información sobre cambios recientes y fluctuaciones de costos a nivel de job para gestión de costos más dirigida.

3. **Análisis Operacional**: Visuales de conteos de ejecuciones de jobs, tiempos de ejecución y tasas de fallo a través de diferentes dimensiones, ofreciendo información sobre eficiencia operacional, tasas de éxito de jobs y patrones en ejecución de jobs a través de equipos y triggers.

4. **Análisis de Clusters**: Métricas de utilización de recursos, incluyendo uso de CPU y memoria, utilización pico por job, y jobs con configuraciones desactualizadas, soportando gestión eficiente de clusters y optimización de configuración.

En conjunto, estas secciones y filtros proporcionan una vista holística de rendimiento de jobs, costos y utilización de recursos, empoderando a los equipos para tomar decisiones basadas en datos para optimizar configuraciones de jobs, reducir costos operacionales y mejorar el rendimiento general.

#### System Tables Utilizadas
- system.billing.usage
- system.billing.list_prices
- system.lakeflow.jobs
- system.lakeflow.job_run_timeline
- system.compute.clusters
- system.access.table_lineage

frame.title: Costo 30d por Equipo
frame.description: Distribución de costos de jobs de los últimos 30 días por equipo. Cada color representa un equipo diferente basado en los tags de los jobs. Útil para asignación de costos y facturación por equipo.

frame.title: Gasto Semanal por Equipo
frame.description: Evolución temporal del gasto semanal de jobs por equipo. Cada línea representa un equipo diferente basado en los tags de los jobs. Útil para rastrear tendencias de consumo por equipo a lo largo del tiempo.

frame.title: Tendencia de Tiempo de Ejecución de Job
frame.description: Evolución del tiempo promedio de ejecución de jobs por tipo de SKU. Cada color representa un SKU diferente. Útil para detectar degradación de rendimiento y comparar eficiencia entre tipos de compute.

frame.title: Distribución de Costos de Jobs por Usuario
frame.description: Distribución de costos de jobs por usuario basado en sus ejecuciones. Cada color representa un usuario diferente. Útil para identificar usuarios con mayor consumo de recursos en jobs.

widget.name: 88433c9b
widget.textbox_spec:
### Sección de Desglose de Costos y Análisis de Uso
----
Esta sección proporciona una vista integral de costos relacionados con jobs, desglosados por varias dimensiones para permitir información más profunda sobre patrones de gasto y utilización de recursos. Los elementos clave incluyen:

1. **Costo Diario por Workspace y SKU**: Visuales mostrando tendencias de costos diarios segmentados por workspace y SKU, ayudando a los usuarios a identificar los principales contribuyentes a gastos relacionados con jobs.

2. **Costo por Equipo**: Un desglose de costos por equipo, permitiendo información específica por equipo y responsabilidad en el uso de recursos.

3. **Costo Asignado por Usuarios**: Gráficos mostrando costos de jobs atribuidos a usuarios específicos, dando visibilidad sobre patrones de uso individual y áreas potenciales de optimización.

4. **Costo Diario por Estado**: Análisis de costos diarios segmentados por estado de job, como exitoso, error o cancelado, proporcionando información sobre cómo los resultados de jobs afectan el uso de recursos.

5. **Tabla de Jobs Costosos**: Una tabla listando jobs de alto costo, detallando costos, número de ejecuciones y fuentes asociadas, facilitando optimizaciones dirigidas de operaciones costosas.

Esta sección empodera a los equipos con datos claros y accionables para gestionar costos de jobs efectivamente y optimizar el consumo de recursos relacionados con jobs.

widget.name: 3ce0d928
widget.textbox_spec:
### Sección de Análisis Operacional
----
Esta sección proporciona información operacional sobre patrones de ejecución de jobs, duraciones de ejecución y confiabilidad, soportando a los equipos en optimizar eficiencia de jobs y solucionar problemas. Las visualizaciones clave incluyen:

1. **Cambio en Conteo de Ejecuciones de Jobs a lo Largo del Tiempo por Equipo**: Una vista de tendencia de conteos de ejecuciones de jobs a lo largo del tiempo, organizada por equipo, que permite a los equipos evaluar sus niveles de actividad de jobs e identificar cualquier cambio operacional.

2. **Tiempo de Ejecución de Job por Día por Nombre de Job y SKU**: Visualiza tiempos de ejecución diarios agrupados por nombre de job y SKU, ayudando a los usuarios a identificar jobs intensivos en recursos y optimizar configuración o programación de jobs.

3. **Tiempo de Ejecución por Tipo de Trigger y Estado**: Un desglose de tiempos de ejecución de jobs segmentados por tipo de trigger (ej., cron, periódico) y estado, proporcionando información sobre la eficiencia y tasas de éxito de diferentes triggers de jobs.

4. **Top 10 Jobs con Mayor Tiempo de Ejecución (Últimos 7 Días)**: Muestra los jobs de mayor duración en la última semana, permitiendo a los equipos examinar y potencialmente optimizar jobs que consumen mucho tiempo.

5. **Jobs con Más Fallos (Últimos 30 Días)**: Identifica jobs con mayor número de fallos en el último mes, destacando jobs que pueden necesitar troubleshooting para mejorar confiabilidad.

Esta sección ofrece una vista integral de operaciones de jobs, empoderando a los equipos para monitorear rendimiento, solucionar problemas de jobs con altos fallos y mejorar eficiencia operacional a través de sus cargas de trabajo.

widget.name: 71ccb23c
widget.textbox_spec:
### Sección de Análisis de Clusters
----
Esta sección proporciona información detallada sobre la utilización de recursos de clusters de jobs, ayudando a los equipos a optimizar configuraciones de clusters para eficiencia de costos y rendimiento. Los componentes clave incluyen:

1. **Utilización Promedio de Memoria y CPU a Través de Jobs**: Visualizaciones de utilización de memoria y CPU a través de todos los jobs, ofreciendo una visión general de demandas de recursos y ayudando a identificar áreas potenciales para mejoras de eficiencia.

2. **Utilización Pico y Promedio de Memoria y CPU por Job**: Una tabla con métricas detalladas sobre el uso pico y promedio de recursos de cada job, permitiendo a los equipos identificar jobs intensivos en recursos y afinar configuraciones para rendimiento óptimo.

3. **Jobs con Número Fijo de Workers**: Identifica jobs ejecutándose con un conteo fijo de workers, proporcionando información sobre distribución de carga de trabajo y ayudando a los equipos a evaluar si el escalado dinámico podría mejorar la eficiencia.

4. **Jobs Ejecutándose en DBR Desactualizado**: Lista jobs usando versiones desactualizadas de Databricks Runtime (DBR), alentando a los equipos a actualizar para mejor rendimiento, seguridad y compatibilidad.

5. **Jobs Ejecutándose en Compute de Propósito General**: Muestra jobs ejecutándose en clusters de propósito general, ayudando a identificar oportunidades para trasladar cargas de trabajo a clusters específicos de jobs, que pueden ser más rentables.

Esta sección soporta asignación efectiva de recursos y ajuste de rendimiento destacando áreas donde las configuraciones de clusters de jobs podrían ser optimizadas para reducir costos y mejorar rendimiento.

frame.description: Muestra jobs con mayor variación de costos entre dos períodos comparables. Compara el gasto del último período vs el período anterior. Útil para detectar aumentos significativos de costos de jobs y tomar acciones correctivas.

frame.title: Jobs Más Costosos Últimos 30 Días
frame.description: Lista los jobs más costosos e incluye el costo total de los últimos 30 días combinados. Útil para identificar jobs que requieren optimización.

widget.name: 7519e499
widget.textbox_spec:
### Sección de Comparación de Costos y Análisis de Cambios
----
Esta sección permite a los usuarios comparar costos de jobs sobre marcos de tiempo personalizables, proporcionando una vista enfocada de cambios de gasto y fluctuaciones de costos recientes. Al ingresar un número específico de días (ej., 7 días), los usuarios pueden ver:

1. **Resumen Comparativo de Costos**: Muestra el costo del período elegido (ej., últimos 7 días) junto con el período anterior, permitiendo información rápida sobre tendencias de gasto recientes y anomalías potenciales.

2. **Análisis Detallado de Cambios**: Un desglose de cambios de costos a nivel de job dentro del marco de tiempo seleccionado, destacando jobs específicos con aumentos o disminuciones notables. Esta granularidad ayuda a los usuarios a identificar áreas donde los costos relacionados con jobs han cambiado y proporciona información para optimización dirigida.

Esta sección soporta gestión proactiva de costos facilitando detectar tendencias y actuar sobre cambios en gasto relacionado con jobs, asegurando que los equipos puedan mantener control sobre asignación de recursos y eficiencia de costos.

frame.title: Conteo de Ejecuciones de Jobs a lo Largo del Tiempo
frame.description: Evolución del número de ejecuciones de jobs por equipo. Cada línea representa un equipo diferente. Útil para rastrear actividad por equipo e identificar picos de uso.

frame.title: Jobs con Más Fallos Últimos 30 Días
frame.description: Shows jobs with a high number of failed runs over the last 30 days; includes number of runs, number of failures, the success ratio, and list cost of the job’s failed runs.

frame.title: Ejecuciones con Más Reintentos Últimos 30 Días
frame.description: Lista jobs con reintentos frecuentes en los últimos 30 días, incluyendo el número de reintentos, la duración acumulada de los reintentos y el costo de los mismos. Tiempo NULL indica que no hubo reintento exitoso aún. Útil para identificar jobs inestables.

frame.title: Jobs con Costos Atípicos Últimos 30 Días
frame.description: Ayuda a analizar la desviación de costos del job a través de múltiples ejecuciones. Muestra jobs con variaciones significativas de costo entre ejecuciones. Útil para detectar problemas de rendimiento inconsistente.

frame.title: Conteo de Ejecuciones 30d
frame.description: Distribución del número de ejecuciones de jobs por workspace en los últimos 30 días. Útil para identificar qué workspaces tienen mayor actividad de jobs.

frame.title: Conteo de Jobs 30d
frame.description: Distribución del número de jobs únicos por workspace en los últimos 30 días. Útil para comparar la cantidad de jobs activos entre workspaces.

frame.title: Distribución Diaria de Estado de Ejecución
frame.description: Muestra el porcentaje de jobs por estado (exitoso, fallido, cancelado, etc.) a lo largo del tiempo. Cada color representa un estado diferente. Útil para identificar períodos con mayor tasa de fallos y problemas de confiabilidad.

frame.title: Tiempo de Ejecución de Job por Tipo de Trigger y Estado
frame.description: Mapa de calor que muestra el tiempo promedio de ejecución por tipo de trigger (cron, manual, etc.) y estado (exitoso, fallido). Colores más intensos indican mayor tiempo. Útil para identificar qué tipos de triggers tienen mejor rendimiento.

frame.title: Tiempo de Ejecución de Job por Día
frame.description: Evolución del tiempo total de ejecución de jobs por nombre de job. Cada color representa un job diferente. Útil para identificar jobs con mayor carga de procesamiento y optimizar distribución de trabajo.

frame.title: Distribución Diaria de Costo por Estado de Ejecución
frame.description: Muestra el porcentaje de costo por estado de job (exitoso, error, cancelado, etc.) a lo largo del tiempo. Cada color representa un estado diferente. Útil para identificar cuánto costo se desperdicia en jobs fallidos y optimizar confiabilidad.

frame.title: Top 10 Jobs de Mayor Duración 30d
frame.description: Muestra los 10 jobs con mayor tiempo de ejecución promedio en los últimos 30 días. Útil para identificar jobs que requieren optimización de rendimiento.

frame.title: Utilización de CPU y Memoria por Job
frame.description: Detalles tabulares mostrando utilización de CPU y memoria para cada job. Por defecto ordenado por menor memoria promedio, pero puede ordenarse por otras columnas haciendo clic en el nombre de columna correspondiente.

frame.title: Utilización Promedio de CPU y Memoria en Jobs
frame.description:
Utilización promedio de memoria y CPU a través de diferentes jobs. El eje X representa jobs (no tiempo) y al pasar el cursor mostrará el nombre del job.
- Jobs con baja CPU y memoria no están aprovechando completamente el potencial del hardware; considera reducir recursos.
- Jobs con muy alta utilización de memoria podrían experimentar cuellos de botella; considera aumentar asignación de memoria.

frame.title: Jobs con Número Fijo de Workers Últimos 30 Días
frame.description: Estos jobs no aprovechan autoscaling, considera agregarlo para optimizar la utilización de recursos.

frame.title: Jobs con Versión DBR Desactualizada Últimos 30 Días
frame.description: Muestra jobs usando versiones DBR menores a 15 (última LTS es 16.4). Considera actualizar para obtener mejor rendimiento, seguridad y acceso a nuevas funcionalidades.

frame.title: Jobs Más Frecuentes en Clusters de Propósito General Últimos 30 Días
frame.description: Jobs de alta frecuencia ejecutados en clusters de propósito general podrían prevenir que se apaguen. Considera migrar a clusters específicos de job para mejor eficiencia de costos.

frame.title: Datasets Sin Uso Producidos Últimos 30 Días
frame.description: Muestra datasets sin uso creados por jobs que no están siendo consumidos en ningún lugar. Útil para identificar datos obsoletos que pueden eliminarse para reducir costos de almacenamiento
